alert.note: Alert for Pembina; Walsh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 9:57AM CDT until May 15 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. .The Red River of the North at Drayton has crested and continues to recede. The river point is expected to remain within Minor flood stage into the weekend, falling into Action stage by the late weekend into early next week period. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Drayton. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 38.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 37.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Wednesday was 38.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon and continue falling to 30.1 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
